ygData.subject: Re: Banks
ygData.msgSnippet: Not part of MY game... Some people are so into *making level xx* that I think they lose site of the rest of the game...  I have several friends and
ygData.messageBody:
Not part of MY game... Some people are so into *making level xx* that I
think they lose site of the rest of the game... I have several friends and
aquaintenances (god I know I spelled that wrong!) that are higher levels
than I am because they play more... But I get more of a charge out of
helping the LOWER level people to 'level up' than leveling up myself...
Some see this too as 'twinking', but I am doing it for someone else, not
myself (or any of my characters).

I don't do this by giving them the best armor for free (hey, it cost me
money to make/buy/find) or weapons or any other 'loot'... I do help by
healing them when they need it (gee, I do that with the higher levels too)
and letting them pull mobs that are too low for exp for me, but are still
blue or white to them... Sometimes, I won't even group with them, but
rather just stand by for a heal if they need it (they always do)

But in MY game of EQ there is no 'twinking' and I hope never really will
be...

After all, the object is to QUEST and ADVENTURE, not just "LEVEL UP" on a
daily basis...

Lemac Justerian - High Elf Cleric on Karana server

> From: XxKommiexX@...
>
> Getting twinked is part of the game. I think if someone has another
character
> that has the skill to make cool stuff, or the level to hunt and get awsome
> stuff, they should be allowed to do what they want with it. So getting
> twinked is part of the game, and it happens. Heck, the other day, one of
the
> few Level 50 characters, made a new character, had him going with level 49
> armor, and really high level weapons and stuff. Looked awsome, he made
level
> 8 in an hour. Guess it is just part of the game.
>
> Kondor, Half Elf Paladin
> ~Veeshan~
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> It's finally here! What's your opinion?
